dialog.text: There is water covering the bottom of the image, going up to almost halfway of the height.
The sky is clear and cloudless. On the right of the water, there is an area of grass that covers one fifth from the right.
How thick is the grass? Does it go along the horizon or cover the bottom right corner?

The grass is like a vertical column going from top of the water to the bottom. Its width is about one fifth of the images width but the water eats into it from the left, creating a curve into the grass.
It is pretty jagged, looking like number three inverted.
Got it. Is there anything else in the water?
The water is smeared with chunks of river all across the surface.
Do you mean by the horizon or across the whole area? And whats next?
Across the whole area. There is a layer of clouds above the water, starting pretty thin on the left, going flat and curve up toward the right, making a circle.
Can you elaborate on the right side, particularly the part about the circle?
Certainly. The clouds go mostly flat from the left but at about one fourth from the right, it rolls up, making a circle whose top is one fourth from the top.
Thank you, can you peek to see how its looking?
It looks great but the grass should be thinner vertically and my bad, it is actually trees, not cloud so swap it and we should be good.
